newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Bamerindus Seguros H1 net rises.
newsitem.headline: Bamerindus Seguros H1 net rises.

text.p: Brazilian insurance firm Bamerindus Seguros, controlled by private bank Bamerindus, reported a net profit of 47.474 million reais in the first half, up from 38.837 million in the year-ago period, a company official said.
Jose Luiz Osti Muggiati, Bamerindus Seguros' superintendent, said this year's earnings represented a 22 percent rise from last year.
The firm's net worth rose 12 percent to 666.562 million reais in the first half from 595.469 million reais in the same period of 1995, he added.

The positive results were mostly due to the launch of new products, particularly health insurance plans for small and medium-sized companies and individuals, and an increase in revenues from investments.
The insurance firm has changed its investment portfolio by cutting stock investment and increasing fixed-income transactions.
Bamerindus Seguros, the country's fourth largest insurance firm, was previously controlled by Bamerindus holding company.
It was absorbed by Bamerindus bank in late June under a restructuring plan designed to strengthen the bank and help it overcome its recent liquidity troubles.
